4. Using Firebase with inbox kitten¶

4.1. notes¶

  • This build requires node, npm and go and golang

  • Requires Credit Card information to be present as firebase blaze is required.

  • Requires NPM version 10!

  • Downloading Go: https://github.com/moovweb/gvm

  • Need to install golang

sudo apt-get install golang

4.2. Creating a Firebase Server¶

  1. Login to firebase

  2. Go to “Get Started”

  3. Click Add project

  1. name the project a unique name, such as inboxkittendeploy and choose a parent resource

  2. Google Analytics is optional

  3. Press create project

4.3. Starting the inbox kitten program¶

  1. Start bash terminal

  2. Move to main folder of inboxkitten using cd command

  3. Enter the following command into bash

npm install -g firebase-tools

  1. After that login into fire base using the command.

firebase login

  1. click Y

  2. Change node version to 10 to build the project by entering the following command

n 10

  1. Enter the following command

./deploy.sh

  • MAILGUN DOMAIN: mailgun’s provided email domain e.g. sandboxdsa982912.mailgun.org

  • WEBSITE DOMAIN: <firebase project name>.web.app

  • API KEY: mailgun’s private API key

  1. Enter the following command to see all existing projects

firebase list

  1. To select which project to use, enter the following command

firebase use --add <alias/project name>

  1. Change the directory to the firebase folder and upgrade back node to version 14

cd deploy
cd firebase
n 14

  1. Enter the following command

firebase init hosting

  1. Select which project you want to run on, enter for every other option

  2. To start the server, enter the following command

firebase deploy
